summary: ELECTRICAL SYSTEMS CONTROLLED BY SIGNAL LEVER DO NOT WORK EXCEPT BY HOLDING LEVER IN CERTAIN POSITIONS: I.E. BRAKE LIGHTS, SIGNAL LEVER L UP, TURN SIGNALS SWITCH LEVER UP, HIGH BEAMS NO GO ETC.  ALL THE TIME.

1990 BUICK REGAL HAD EQUIPMENT FAILURE. CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER TO THE SHOULDER UNDER CONTROL WITHOUT ANY PROBLEMS.  *KB  ACCORDING TO THE POLICE REPORT, UPON INSPECTION OF THE HOOD LATCH AND BRACKET, THE OFFICER DISCOVERED PART OF THE BRACKET AT THE FRONT OF THE ENGINE BAY WAS MISSING. THE BOLT WAS MISSING AS WELL.  THE CRASH WAS DUE TO THE HOOD LATCH  AND BRACKET COMING APART, WHICH CAUSED THE HOOD TO OPEN AND SLAM AGAINST THE WINDSHIELD. THE CONSUMER WAS INJURED. (OHIO TRAFFIC CRASH REPORT).

THE REAR CRADLE BOLTS BROKE AND THE CRADLE SEPARATED FROM THE BODY OF THE VEHICLE. THIS CAUSED THE STEERING LINKAGE COUPLERS TO SEPARATE AND FALL OFF,  RESULTING  IN LOSS OF STEERING. THIS OCCURRED BECAUSE THE CRADLE BOLTS RUSTED. THIS  WOULD NOT HAVE OCCURRED IF CORROSIVE RESTRAINT PARTS WERE USED WHEN THE REAR CRADLE BOLT RECALL 97V058000  REPAIRS WERE  PERFORMED, PER THE DEALERSHIP.*AK  A RECALL WAS ISSUED FOR THE FRONT AND REAR CRADLE BOLTS.  THE CONSUMER CONTACTED THE MANUFACTURER TO FIND OUT WHEN OR IF THE BOLTS WERE EVER REPLACED.  THE REPRESENTATIVE INDICATED THAT THERE WERE NO OUTSTANDING RECALL ON THE VEHICLE BUT  COULD NOT TELL THE CONSUMER WHEN THE RECALL WERE DONE.  *NM

RIGHT FRONT WHEEL  VIBRATED. DRIVER PULLED OVER, PULLED OFF LUGS, AND NOTICED THE  RIM WAS CRACKED.  DEALER WAS CONTACTED.  RECALL 94V041000  WAS ISSUED ON THIS MAKE, MODEL, AND YEAR,  BUT THIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED UNDER RECALL DUE TO VIN.  *AK

AFTER THE RECALL FOR THE CRADLE BOLTS WAS COMPLETED, THE STEERING FAILED. RECALL  #00 V 189 000.  *JB    AFTER THE RECALL FOR THE CRADLE BOLTS WAS COMPLETED, THE STEERING FAILED. RECALL  #00 V 189 000. THERE WAS A CLASS ACTION SUIT ON BRAKES-CONSUMER'S BRAKES FAILED AFTER THE CLASS ACTION SUIT.*MR

CONSUMERS SON WAS IN OPERATION OF THE VEHICLE WHEN SUDDENLY ALL STEERING WAS LOST.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED AND IT WAS EXPLAINED THAT THE FRAME HAD SEPARATED FROM THE CHASSIS AND HAD DROPPED, DISENGAGING THE STEERING ASSEMBLY.  THE CAUSE WAS THE CRADLE BOLTS HAD PULLED THROUGH THE RETAINERS DUE TO CORROSION.  BUICK SENT CONSUMER A RECALL NOTICE SHORTLY AFTER REGARDING THE SAME PROBLEM.  BUICK TOLD CONSUMER TO SEND THE REPAIR BILL TO THEM FOR REIMBURSEMENT.  CONSUMER HAS NOT HEARD FROM THEM SINCE.  *JG
WHILE APPLYING BRAKES AT 20 MPH  BRAKE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR ,AND  VEHICLE CONTINUE ON BEFORE STOPPING. DEALER CONTACTED. FEEL FREE TO PROVIDE ANY FURTHER  INFORMATION.*AKI
REAR BRAKE CALIPERS WOULD LOCK UP WHEN  BRAKES  WERE APPLIED. HAD  BRAKES REPLACED TWICE DUE TO PADS WEARING EXCESSIVELY. MECHANIC INDICATED  CAUSE OF PROBLEM WAS  MASTER CYLINDER.*AK
REAR CALIPERS CONSITANTLY FAILING. *AK
WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES  PEDAL GOES TO  FLOOR, CAUSING EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE.  CAUSE UNKNOWN.  PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.*AK

WHILE MAKING A TURN HEARD A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM  LEFT SIDE OF  CAR.  TOOK TO DEALER, AND  PUT ON FRONT CRADLE BOLTS AND WASHER, BUT NEVER DID REAR. CONSUMER FELT LIKE  REAR HAS GONE BAD, AND  THEY MAY LOOSE STEERING.*AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

CONSUMER WAS TRAVELING AT  65MPH ON  EXPRESSWAY AND ANOTHER VEHICLE MADE A SUDDEN U-TURN IN  MIDDLE OF  STREET, AND   HIT  CONSUMER'S VEHICLE FROM  SIDE OF  CAR. UPON IMPACT, AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY.  *AK

VEHICLES STEERING FAILED SUDDENLY WHILE PULLING OUT OF A PARKING LOT, CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER TO SEE IF IT WAS COVERED UNDER RECALL 00V-189 BUT THE DEALER WAS NOT VERY COOPERATIVE.  NLM
CONSUMER CONTACTED DEALER AND THE PART WAS ON ORDER.*AK
WHILE DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD VEHICLE WAS SOUNDING LIKE SOMETHING WAS RATTLING AND IT WAS JERKING. ALSO,  CONSUMER SAW A LOT OF SMOKE, THEN VEHICLE CUT OFF.*AK
REAR BRAKES FAILED. YH
WHILE TRAVELING AND DEPRESSING THE BRAKES VEHICLE STALLED/SURGED AND IDLED TO HIGH RPMS. CONSUMER  STATED BRAKES HAVE TO BE DEPRESSED MOST OF TRAVELING.   *AK *ML
CRADLE BOLTS RUSTED AND BROKEN CAUSING FRAME TO COME APART, RESULTING IN LOSS OF STEERING CONTROL. MJS
FRONT CRADLE RUSTED AND FELL DOWN WHILE DRIVING CAUISING LOSS OF STEERINF ABILITY AND LOSS OF CONTROL.  *YC
WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES  PEDAL GOES TO THE FLOOR . OWNER HAS TO USE THE EMERGENCY BRAKE TO  STOP. DEALER SAYS NOTHING WRONG WITH VEHICLE. BRAKES ARE COMPLETELY GONE AGAIN.  *AK
LEFT REAR WHEEL FELL OFF OF VEHICLE CAUSING LOSS OF CONTROL AND VEHICLE COLLISION. (OHIO TRAFFIC CRASH REPORT). MJS

WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 20MPH FRAME ON VEHICLE BROKE. IT HAPPENED WHERE THE CRADLE BOLTS ARE LOCATED. THE ENGINE DROPPED & BROKE THE STEERING SHAFT. NO STEERING CONTROL. THE CRACKS HAD OCCURRED IN THE FRAME. HAD VEHICLE TOWED TO DEALER TO CHECK. *AK

DOOR WAS FORCED OPENED BY THE FORCE, DOOR LATCH PULLED STRIKER FROM DOOR PILLAR AND DOOR OPEN LEAVING THE SEAT BELT USELESS , AS A SAFETY RESTRAINT, AND PASSANGER WAS EJECTED AND KILLED. THE DOOR MOUNTED DESIGN IS TOTALLY USELESS ON DOOR OPENING, SEATBELTS SHOULD STAY ON PELVIS, IN ALL ACCIDENT CONDITIONS, G.M INSTALLED THIS DESIGN IN THOUSANDS OF VEHICLES, THEY SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN ABLE TO PUT THESE TYPE OF RESTAINT IN THEIR VEHICLES, ANYBODY WITH ANY KIND OF BRAINS SHOULD HAVE SEEN THAT, THEIR ENGINEERS ARE STUPID OR THEY DON'T CARE. THIS TYPE OF SEAT BELT RESTRAINT SYSTEM KILLED MY DAUGHTER,  AND THERE WILL BE MANY PEOPLE DYING BECAUSE OF THIS, G.M. SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN ALLOWED PUT THIS TYPE OF RESTRAINT IN THERE DOOR.

NOT STARTING (ENGINE TRIES TO START BUT JUST WON'T CATCH) AND STALLING WHILE IDLING.  #1 OF 6:  TOOK CAR FROM HOME, DROVE ABOUT 15 MILES, TURNED IT OFF FOR OVER AN HOUR, DROVE ABOUT 1/10 MILE, TURNED IT OFF FOR OVER AN HOUR, WOULDN'T START.  LEFT IT SIT FOR 30 MINUTES.  STARTED UP JUST FINE.  #2 OF 6:  TOOK CAR FROM HOME, DROVE ABOUT 5 MILES, TURNED IT OFF FOR 2 HOURS, DROVE ABOUT 1/2 MILE, TURNED IT OFF FOR  ABOUT 15 MINUTES, WOULDN'T START.  LEFT IT SIT FOR 10 MINUTES.  STARTED UP FINE, ALTHOUGH I FOLLOWED PROCEDURE FOR FLOODED ENGINE.  STOPPED ABOUT 2 BLOCKS AGAIN TO GET GAS.  STARTED UP FINE AGAIN.  #3 OF 6:  TOOK CAR FROM HOME, DID A LOT OF START/STOP DRIVING THAT MORNING.  LATER THAT AFTERNOON DROVE ABOUT 10 MILES, TURNED IF OFF FOR OVER AN HOUR, STARTED UP FINE, DROVE ABOUT 1/2 MILE, HAD TO STOP AT STOP LIGHT.  WHILE IDLING, STALLED OUT.  WOULDN'T START FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES.  AT THIS POINT I TOOK IT TO THE DEALER.  THE DEALER REPLACED THE PROM AND IDLE AIR CONTROL VALVE.    #4 OF 6:  2 DAYS AFTER DEALER REPLACED THE ABOVE, IT STALLED AFTER FILLING THE GAS TANK AND DRIVING JUST A SHORT DISTANCE.  HOWEVER, UNLIKE ALL OTHER TIMES IT STARTED UP WITHIN A MINUTE.  (IT WAS RAINY THAT EVENING.)  TOOK BACK TO DEALER.  HE SEALED THE CONNECTIONS - THOUGHT MAYBE THEY GOT WET.  #5 OF 6:  ABOUT 5 WEEKS LATER WE WENT ON A LONG TRIP AND ALL WAS WELL UNTIL WE WENT TO A STORE AND BACK AND THEN ABOUT 30 MINUTES LATER IT WOULD NOT START.  #6 OF 6:  DROVE HOME FROM WORK (14 MILES), STOPPED FOR GAS ABOUT 1 MILE FROM HOME, FILLED TANK, DROVE HOME, LEFT CAR SIT FOR 45 MINUTES, DROVE ABOUT 3 MILES, LEFT CAR SIT FOR 1 AND 1/4 HOURS, WOULDN'T START.  HAD RAINED EARLIER IN THE DAY, BUT THE ROADS WERE FAIRLY DRY.  THIS HAPPENED TONIGHT.  TOMORROW I WILL PHONE THE DEALER.    DOES THIS HAPPEN TO OTHER REGAL OWNERS AND WHAT HAS BEEN DONE TO CORRECT IT? I AM ALMOST SCARED TO DRIVE ANYMORE.  DEPENDING WHERE IT STALLS, THIS COULD CAUSE AN ACCIDENT.  MIGHT I ADD THAT I HAVEN'T HAD ANY MAJOR PRO

I HAVE AN ONGOING PROBLEM WITH THE  BRAKES ON MY 1990 BUICK REGAL.  AFTER MANY REPAIRS AND REPLACEMENTS TO THE FRONT BRAKE SYSTEM . I DISCOVERED THAT THE ROOT CAUSE WAS THE  MALFUNCTION OF THE REAR BRAKES.  THE REAR CALIPERS ARE DESIGNED, THAT WHEN THEY CORRODE THE BRAKING ACTION IS DIMINISHED AND EVENTUALLY STOPS WHEN THE CALIPERS ARE COMPLETELY FROZEN. THIS FAILURE CAUSES SUBSEQUENT PROBLEMS :  1. BECAUSE THE FRONT BRAKES NOW CARRY MORE BREAKING LOAD THE PAD WEARS OUT VERY QUICKLY. 2. BECAUSE THE FRONT BRAKES NOW CARRY MORE BREAKING LOAD THE ROTORS WILL  WARP AND REQUIRE FREQUENT TURNING,  WHICH EVENTUALLY RENDERS THE ROTOR BELOW SPECIFIED THICKNESS AND MUST BE REPLACED .  3. THE REAR CALIPERS CAN SOMETIMES LOCK IN THE ENGAGED POSITION. THIS WILL CAUSE EXCESS AND POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS HEAT IN THE BRAKES. THIS WILL EVENTUALLY RUIN ROTORS AND MAY PRESENT A FIRE HAZARD.   4. THE LACK OF BREAKING IN THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE CAUSES AN IMBALANCE  IN THE BREAKING  CHARACTERISTICS OF THE VEHICLE. THIS WILL CAUSE THE VEHICLE TO LERCH SIDEWAYS IN AN EMERGENCY BREAKING SITUATION AS THE INERTIA FROM THE REAR IS NOT IMPEDED, MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO STOP WITH ANY CONTROL.  I HAVE EXPERIENCED ALL 4 OF THESE CONDITIONS ON MY VEHICLE. ITEMS 1-3 ARE TROUBLESOME BECAUSE THE COST IMPACT HAS BEEN SIGNIFICANT . BUT THE 4TH  ITEM IS CAUSE FOR MY GREATEST CONCERN AS I SEE THIS AS A SERIOUS LIFE AND SAFETY DEFECT. I HAVE EXPERIENCED FIRST HAND THE EFFECT OF THIS CONDITION WHEN MAKING AN EMERGENCY BREAKING MANEUVER. MY VEHICLE LITERALLY SNAPPED SIDEWAYS INTO THE ONCOMING LANE WHEN I HAD TO JAMB ON THE BREAKS. LUCKILY BECAUSE THE ROAD CONDITIONS WERE DRY AND TRAFFIC WAS LIGHT, I WAS ABLE TO GAIN CONTROL AND EVENTUALLY STOP THE VEHICLE.  AN ADDITIONAL IMPORTANT FACTOR IS,  THERE IS NO ADVANCED  INDICATION  THAT THE REAR CALIPERS HAVE FROZEN OR NOT FUNCTIONING PROPERLY, PUTTING THE SAFETY OF  OPERATOR AND PASSENGERS AT SIGNIFICANT RISK.   THIS MUST EFFECT ALL THE OTHER GM MODELS THAT HAVE THE
PASSENGER'S SIDE FRONT LAB BELT FAILED DURING AN ACCIDENT, DAUGHTER WAS THROWN OUT OF VEHICLE AND KILLED, THREE OTHER PASSENGER'S WERE INJURED.
